intro: Pappea ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda pappea, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, dry capsules containing seeds. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
